column4: can anyone do me a favour and test my ftp to see if they can connect? i'll pm you the info

okay i've turned on logging in node.conf and after trying to connect with the windows nx client nothing is written to the log. it seems like the client isnt even ATTEMPTING to connect.
right... are you sure you put in the correct IP address and that there's no firewall in the way?
it's on my local network, going through the router. 192.168.0.12 to ssh to it... 192.168.0.12 in nxclient chokes
now when i try to do anything with nxserver ie --status, --restart it just 'freezes' and stops responding until i press enter, and then it says "quit Quit"
the problem seems to be in your network
: but if i have no firewall and i can ssh to it what could block nx?
wait a sec: you *manually* downloaded packages right?
the .deb files? i just added your site to my sources.list and did apt-get
i think im just going to reinstall breezy when i get home because this shit is insane, i'm out of ideas
